report_title: Drug and Alcohol Test Kit Manufacturing Industry Report
executive_summary: Drug and alcohol test kit manufacturers have benefited in recent years as demand for drug and alcohol test kits has risen. In recent years, growing rates of substance abuse and the penetration of fentanyl into the drug supply has made test kits more critical than ever. Manufacturers' growth was disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic, as priorities abruptly shifted to combatting the pandemic. Several manufacturers, including industry leader Abbott, pivoted to develop and produce test strips that could detect the virus. Still, elevated rates of substance abuse post-COVID led manufacturers to recover revenue quickly, although global supply chain snags and labor shortages have been challenging to navigate, straining profit.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Drug and alcohol test kit manufacturers have benefited in recent years as demand for drug and alcohol test kits has risen. Yet, solid growth occurring prior to the COVID-19 pandemic came to a halt as priorities abruptly shifted to combatting the pandemic. Several manufacturers, including industry leader Abbott, pivoted to develop and produce test strips that could detect the virus. Managing disruptions to the global supply chain and labor force have also been challenging for manufacturers, straining profit growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Manufacturers Are Critical to Combatting an Opioid Crisis
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Fentanyl has become the leading cause of overdose deaths in the US. The alarming statistic has pressured state governments to act to combat the crisis, with manufacturers developing test strips having a central role. 21 states – with more expected – have decriminalized the use of fentanyl test strips, leading more manufacturers to introduce new ones specifically designed to detect the powerful opioid. The increased availability of fentanyl test strips is also bringing more parents and educators to advocate for kits at home and in schools. Elevated need for test kits is offsetting the drop off in THC tests kits in states where recreational marijuana use is legal.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Changes in Drug Screening Policies Will Likely Affect Manufacturers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Shifting societal attitudes about recreational drug use will continue to lead more employers to adjust drug screening requirements. While employer-sanctioned drug tests aren't a part of this industry, sales of drug test kits could slow down as employees feel less inclined to test themselves with at-home kits. At the same time, legalization of marijuana in more and more states has been diminishing the need for test kits detecting THC. Federal officials are loosening drug screening requirements to attract younger workers, with some states barring employers from discriminating against an employee for marijuana use outside of work.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures home diagnostic kits that test for the presence of alcohol or drugs in an individual. Test kits are intended for home use, although some may require a tester to send a sample to an authorized laboratory.
key_trends: Consumers are the largest buyers of at-home drug and alcohol test kits
Demand from Mental Health and Substance Abuse Clinics

market_segmentation.segment_description: Pharmacies are the largest sellers of drug and alcohol test kits.

products_and_services.product_description: A single panel drug test kit detects the presence of a single specific drug or substance in a person's system.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Single Panel Drug Tests are the Leading Product Line
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Single panel drug test kits detecting THC are the most common test kit produced by manufacturers.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Ireland is the largest exporter of test kits to the United States.

business_locations.location_description: California has the most test kit manufacturers in the West and the US.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Food and Drug Administration regulates the efficacy, design and accuracy of drug tests in the United States.

basis_points.basis_title: Shortfalls of at-home test kits weigh on manufacturers
basis_points.basis_description: No manufacturer can deliver an entirely accurate or reliable at-home test.

concentration_points.concentration_title: NO SINGLE MANUFACTURER CONTROLS THE MARKET
concentration_points.concentration_description: Drug and alcohol test kit manufacturing has many diverse competitors.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Drug and alcohol test kit manufacturers purchase various components to develop kits.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Drug test kit manufacturing is more labor-intensive.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The COVID-19 pandemic disrupted manufacturers' operating landscape.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: SINGLE PANEL DRUG TESTS ARE THE LEADING PRODUCT LINE

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Imports account for a significant portion of industry revenue.
